title: Kabul
summary: Kabul (/ˈkɑːbʊl, kəˈbʊl/; Pashto: کابل‎, romanized: Kābəl, IPA: [kɑˈbəl]; Dari: کابل‎, romanized: Kābol, IPA: [kɒːˈbol]) is the capital and largest city of Afghanistan, located in the eastern section of the country. It is also a municipality, forming part of the greater Kabul Province, and divided into 22 districts. According to estimates in 2021, the population of Kabul was 4.6 million[5][6][7] and it serves as Afghanistan's political, cultural and economical center.[8] Rapid urbanization has made Kabul the world's 75th largest city.[9]
